intro: Lobivia salitrensis, commonly known as the saltbush lobivia, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and fleshy, often blue-green leaves. Lobivia salitrensis is adapted to survive in harsh, saline environments, making it a hardy and resilient species. Its small, star-shaped flowers typically bloom in shades of yellow and white, adding a delicate beauty to its arid habitat.
